alert.note: Alert for Custer; Garfield; Loup; Wheeler (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 7:56PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Loup, Garfield, northeastern Custer, southeastern Blaine and southwestern Wheeler Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 755 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Ericson to 12 miles west of Taylor. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burwell, Taylor, Bartlett, Ericson, Calamus Reservoir State Recreation Area, Virginia Smith Dam, Buffalo Flats, Cumminsville, Four Corners, Horseshoe Bend Lake, Almeria, Nunda Shoal Campground, Deverre, and Gables. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 120 and 136. Highway 281 between mile markers 133 and 150. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central and north central Nebraska.
